channel.title: What were your wins in July?
channel.description:
What did you accomplish in July?
- I did sucessfully capitalize on the Windows 10 launch (and the new Microsoft browser) by collecting leads with a free tool ([DoesItWorkOnEdge.com][1]) - This has resulted in a ~25& growth in revenue :smile: [1]: http://DoesItWorkOnEdge.com

item.title: What were your wins in July?
item.dc:creator: kalenjordan
item.description:
Hired my first perso (part time) n in a customer support role!

Read full topic
item.source: What were your wins in July?

item.title: What were your wins in July?
item.dc:creator: pjc
item.description:
In July I went from 3 to 20 paying customers for my Shopify app. App is $15/month but Shopify keeps 20%.

Read full topic
item.source: What were your wins in July?

item.title: What were your wins in July?
item.dc:creator: jasonswett
item.description:
I seem to have gotten one new customer. I can’t be 100% sure until after the 30-day trial is over but all the right signs are there. It’s probably not obvious but one customer per month is a pretty good number for me at this stage.

And the more gratifying part of what’s been going on is that my sales funnel that’s been in place since late May is continuing to function as hoped and expected. It’s a wonderful feeling after years of mostly frustration.

Read full topic
item.source: What were your wins in July?
